Glendale.The Sanford Meisner Center for the Arts:
The Sanford Meisner Center for the Arts was the first and only theater and school created by Sanford Meisner himself.
In 1985, Meisner and Jimmy Carville co-founded The Meisner/Carville School of Acting on the island of Bequia in the West Indies. Then in 1995, they extended the school to North Hollywood, California at The Sanford Meisner Center for the Arts; a theater company which was founded by Sanford Meisner, James Carville, Martin Barter and Jill Gatsby.
